subject: Science
title: Radioactivity: Unstable Atoms
description: Learn Radioactivity: Unstable Atoms in one minute.

hook.text: Some atoms are so unstable they spontaneously break apart, releasing energy.

buildup.text: Henri Becquerel discovered radioactivity in 1896 when uranium fogged his photographic plates.

discovery.text: Unstable nuclei emit particles or energy â€” alpha, beta, or gamma radiation.

twist.text: Marie Curie isolated radium and polonium. She carried radioactive samples in her pockets.

climax.text: Curie died of radiation exposure. Her notebooks are still too radioactive to handle safely.

punchline.text: Marie Curie's notebooks will be radioactive for 1,500 more years. Discovery has a cost.

quiz.question: Why are Marie Curie's notebooks still dangerous?
options: They were exposed to X-rays during experiments
